campaign.story:
Be Seen As The Hero Of Your Story!
NeverEnding is developing a new toolbox for D&D players, DMs, other TTRPG gamers, and storytellers of all kinds. Featuring a built in Character Builder, with beautiful hand-drawn options so you can create your heroes, villains, and NPCs how you see them. 
Whether you play Dungeons & Dragons 5E, Pathfinder 2E, Call of Cthulhu, Savage Worlds, Cyberpunk, or another game, we have something for you!
Introducing TWO New body options plus FOURTEEN additional armor options!
With this Kickstarter we’re expanding our body options, and giving you more fantasy clothing options, plus so many amazing new weapons to choose from.
There's even MORE New weapons an shields we're adding! More than 50 new options in total!
Tell us what other options you'd like us to add in the comments!
 The Beta is Live at https://www.beneverending.app/ and already has loads of options.

You can also capture your character’s backstory and personality by adding a bio.
 Tokens. 
Expected release May 2021
Want to use your character in a virtual tabletop like Roll20 or Fantasy Grounds? We're making it easy! You'll be able to choose from loads of unique and interesting token frames with just a click.
Poses.
Expected release July 2021
Our programmers are hard at work making it so you can change your character's pose with a single click! With this addition we'll be one big step forward in helping you turn your adventures into webcomics and animated videos.
Webcomics and Animated Videos.
Expected BETA July 2021 and October 2021
We're focusing on the Character Builder today, but eventually you'll be able to import your characters into our Scene Creator and Story Animator tools to create and publish party portraits, webcomics, and even animated videos of your adventures and story ideas.
 Late Addition Stretch Goal!
(April 9 update) We're really excited to have unlocked Wolfborn and Kitsune options, but someone reminded us we forgot my favorite of them all. MOUSEFOLK!
If you can help us get to $7,000 by April 10 at 11:59 pm (EDT), we'll include Mousefolk options, even though they weren't part of the original plan. 
(How could we not have included them? Help us fix this oversight!)
So, if the Character Builder App is already live in Beta... why back it now?
Don't wait. Support us because you want more options faster. 
Don't pay for expansions. Unlock stretch goals to include those features for YOU for free!

1. We want to introduce these two new body types, 14 armor options, 50+ new weapon and shield options, PLUS even more if you back us and unlock stretch goals. Even though we've drawn these new bodies, there's a lot of work still to render the different armor and other options, so they can be included in the builder. If you back us, it'll give us the boost we need to secure additional time from our artists make these and more character options available to you.

2. Other than the new body choices, most of the options we're including in this Kickstarter will be available only as specific purchases, achievements, or as "Hero Tier" member items. Hero Tier members are those who purchase a full year membership - OR Back Us On Kickstarter (that's you). By backing us today - you get access to premium features for 18 months (that's *counts fingers and toes* way more than 12)! And you never loose your saved characters, even if you don't renew.

***We can't say this enough: you ALWAYS have access to all your created characters, plus free tools even if you don't renew your membership.***

3. Finally, supporting us by backing the Kickstarter tells us that there are people who want to use the character builder and that we should continue investing in expanding and improving both features and options.

How We'll Use The Funds
Now that we've successfully launched a robust Beta of our Character Builder, and are approaching 2,000 members - it's time to give you MORE! We're raising funds to add new bigger heroic body types to our character builder, more armor, and more weapons.

Funds will be used to pay for additional time from our team of amazing artists, so they can create all of these hand drawn options for you and make them work in our Character Builder.
Go to https://beneverending.com/about-us/ to see our full team. 
We're all counting on your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there's always a risk of something catastrophic or unexpected, we're well positioned to deliver. This is our second Kickstarter. And we've been delivering on those rewards (like the Character Builder). The Beta is live and the bodies drawn. It's not that much more work - we just need some help from you to get us across the finish line.

We have learned a LOT! While we're still building out the full story animation platform, the Character Builder was a key component. That is live in Beta already. We're approaching 2,000 people using the Character Builder to create their D&D characters, social media avatars, Roll20 tokens and more. 

We add new character options every week and have done a good job streamlining the art pipeline process.

We have the new character models created. It's just a matter of adjusting all of the components to fit the new models, and some of that work has already been done. We need the funds to pay for additional art and programming time from our artists and developers, without slowing down the development of the rest of the platform.

Our big lift was the posing of the characters. We've solved that technical challenge and are working to implement it. We're confident we can deliver according to our timeline!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Greetings, Hero.
Have you ever wanted to see your life as an epic adventure? We were tired of soulless productivity tools that treated us like goal-setting robots, so we created The Hero’s Journal to reshape our goals as a quest. Since our first Kickstarter two years ago, we’ve helped more than 25,000 people become the hero of their own life. We’ve learned a lot about what worked and what people loved. And now, we’re telling a brand new story.
Cauldron Gray
Mystic Blue

Introducing the Istoria Magic Academy
The Istoria Magic Academy is a brand new journal designed to inspire your imagination while functionally organizing your day-to-day life. With 91 unique daily pages, you’ll watch an epic and wholesome story unfold as you progress further on your own adventure. Whether you have a fitness goal, creative project, business plan, or just need a little more order in your life, the Istoria Magic Academy is the perfect companion for your next adventure.
Fueled by Fandom. Backed by Science.
Don’t let the daily artwork of the journal fool you into taking it less seriously—every element on the page is rooted in the best of goal setting psychology. From daily gratitudes and allies and threats to time visualization and quest setting, the Journal will help you organize each day and progress towards your goal. Plus the art isn’t just there for show—as you progress further into your adventure, the journal is designed to continually spark your imagination, giving you a new reason to pursue your goal daily.
What's Inside?
Stories are the oldest form of human communication, and no story is more important to how we live our lives than the story we tell about ourselves. The Hero’s Journal helps you define that story, thanks to:
91 days of journaling with completely unique artwork and design
Daily exercises to define your quest, what’s most important, and what you’re grateful for
Introductory content to understand the theme of your story, the nature of your goal, and how it can become a quest
Periodic reflection questions and self study to reflect your adventure and remind yourself of how far you’ve come
An epic story playing out in the background to spark your imagination and rediscover how magical the world can be
 Outro content to name your quest for what it is and a diploma to remind you of what you really are: a hero! 
Rewards and Tiers
Goodies:
Mystic Blue Pin Set
Cauldron Gray Pin Set
Companion Journal
Boxes (Cauldron Gray, Mystic Blue)

Find Inspiration Daily
Every page in the Istoria Magic Academy is different, making each and every day of your quest a unique experience. Whether you’re fired up about your goal, or have lost sight of why you started, the journal will inspire you and keep you going—even if it’s just to see the next frame of the story!
Make Your World a Little (Or a Lot) More Magical
Stories of magic are, at their core, stories about change: the ability to shape your reality using your words and actions. We love stories of people setting out to learn new things, and the story of learning magic provides a powerful metaphor to the challenges and triumphs of pursuing any goal in the world. With themes of perseverance, learning from failure, and transformation, discover yourself in the twisting hallways and mysterious history of the Istoria Magic Academy!
The Istoria Magic Academy Map Designed by Misty Bee (work in progress picture)

 The Incredible, Awe-Inspiring Story of YOU. 
Whether you're looking to turn your fitness goal into an adventure, find inspiration for your creative project, or just want to inject a little more order & wonder into your every day life, you'll find what you're looking for in the twisting halls and mysterious history of the Istoria Magic Academy!
Stretch Goal Rewards 
Add-Ons!
The Team:
Why Kickstarter?
We launched our very first product on Kickstarter two years ago, and wanted to return as a way to celebrate the growth of our community and launch a brand new story based off of the same principles. Crowdfunding gives us the ability to connect with people who are just as passionate as us about creating new things that make the world a better place, and focus on making something amazing together.
Shipping and Sales Tax
We will ship all tiers from our fulfillment center in Seattle, WA to anywhere in the US and many locations internationally. All units fulfilled within the US will be sent via FedEx and arrive within 2-5 days of receiving the tracking the number. The individual shipping costs are included with each tier.
If state sales tax is applicable on your purchase, we'll follow up with you post-campaign with the cost and a method of payment.
International Shipping
The Hero’s Journal will be available for delivery to select countries around the world. As shipping, handling, local charges and custom fees vary from country to country, please select your reward to see specific details about your location.
Customer is responsible for all applicable taxes or duties that may occur in your location. The Hero’s Journal is shipped delivery duties unpaid (DDU).
You can find a complete list of the shipping costs per pledge as well as full shipping and handling details in our FAQs section. If you’d like to back the project but your country isn’t listed in the dropdown menu upon checkout, or if you have any further questions about shipping, please feel free to contact us.
About the Hero’s Journal
The Hero’s Journal launched as an idea on Kickstarter two years ago and has since grown into a community of people becoming the hero of their quests. Based out of Seattle, WA, The Hero’s Journal is now a small team of creators and storytellers passionate about helping people become the main character of their own story and using storytelling as a method of personal growth.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've learned a lot about how people use The Hero's Journal, but launching a new story with so many updates to the product is always a risk. Not only have we made significant updates to the journal, but it's the first time we've created a companion journal, which has presented problems in early prototyping. This is also the first time we've ever shipped physical products internationally, which is exciting but full of new challenges in calculating cost and understanding fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Mock up of the book. Cover design not finalized.
Coyote and Crow is a tabletop role playing game set in an alternate future of the Americas where colonization never occurred. Instead, advanced civilizations arose over hundreds of years after a massive climate disaster changed the history of the planet. You'll play as adventurers starting out in the city of Cahokia, a bustling, diverse metropolis along the Mississippi River. It's a world of science and spirituality where the future of technology and legends of the past will collide.

The game is created and led by a team of Native Americans representing more than a dozen tribes and we've built a game that both Natives and non-Natives will thrill to explore and build upon.
More than 700 years ago, a bright purple streak shot across the night sky. Over the coming weeks, the Earth fell into a deep winter, the seas raged and ash rained from the sky. The event became known as the Awis. As resources dwindled, winter became longer and summer shorter, people struggled to survive. Wars erupted, people starved, some fleeing their ancestral homes before creeping ice sheets. 
But people survived. Tribes adapted. And in the wake, people began to notice a strange purple mark appearing on people, plants and animals alike. It became known as the Adahnehdi, the Gift, and many took it as a sign that the Great Spirit had not given up on them. 
Eventually, the weather began to ease, the Earth began to heal, and new nations arose. New sciences and technologies, born out of necessity, led to a discovery about the Adahnehdi. It wasn't just a mark, it was a path to abilities and powers, beyond normal human limits. 
The long walk home. Art by Jennifer Lange
Now, 700 years after the world was brought to the brink, a new chapter has begun. Your characters enter a world that is healing but is no less dangerous. The ice sheets are retreating and the seas are calming, but what lay out beyond your borders? The treaties and alliances that made so much sense during the long winters are now eroding and old grudges between nations are not so easily forgotten. New technologies arise almost every day and the rate of change is frightening for some. And then there are the stories. Talk of spirits, monsters, beings of legend. For so many they were just tales to be told around the fire. But now there is talk that these legends may be far more literal than you may have previously believed. Has something awakened them?
the northern continent of Makasing.
Coyote and Crow is an original role playing system built around the exclusive use of D12 dice. Outside of the core rule book, all you'll need to play the game is some pencil and paper and some twelve-sided dice. While there is some complexity to the game, we are striving to present a system that will allow players to refer to the rule book during play as little as possible, keeping most or all of the critical information on your character sheet.
Mock up of the front of a character sheet. Design not finalized.
The basic rule system is centered around collecting a Dice Pool, usually around 5-7 D12s and rolling them to determine either Success or Failure and degree of effect. For example "8" might be the number your Character needs to attempt to do something and every 8 or higher they rolled would be a Success. The more 8's, the more successful they are. 
While combat is a part of Coyote and Crow, the game is actually built around the idea of fighting being only one road to story resolution. The game encourages dialogue, building bridges and finding unique solutions to problems that are not always clearly defined by good and evil. 
Your Characters have Stats like Strength and Spirit and Skills like Investigation and Charm that are modified by their Stats. In addition, when you create your Character, you choose a Path. That Path determines both certain Stat bonuses you receive as well as which Abilities you have access to. Abilities are powers beyond normal human capability, but not at a level where characters would be comparable to superheroes. There are 15 Paths in the core rule book available. In addition, you'll choose an Archetype (Whisperer, Healer, Scout, among others) that will give you Stat and Skill bonuses and a general idea of your character's profession, but will not force your Character too deeply down a specific progression.
Then you'll choose Gifts and Burdens. These allow you to give your Characters specific bonuses or drawbacks and will help you flesh them out in a way that is flavorful and realistic. It's important to note that the rulebook does not dictate whether something is a burden or a gift for a Player. For example, a Player might choose to give their Character a sister. That might be a Burden or a Gift (or both!) depending on how the Player wants their Character to see that relationship.

Sample pages from the equipment chapter. Layouts and content not finalized.

There are no experience points in Coyote and Crow. Instead, it is built on the Legends system. Your Character will have Short Term Goals, which will increase various numbers on your Character sheets or give them new Skills. But you and your group will also have Long Term Goals. When those are completed your legend will grow. You'll write a short story about your adventures, the kind that can be told around the fire for generations to come. These can change your Gifts and Burdens, give you access to new Abilities and more. As you complete more Long Term Goals, your Character's legend will precede them and your stories will spread.

ARCHETYPES
There are six Archetypes in the game, each acting as a starting point for Character development but not constricting their possibilities. Each Archetype has its own symbol. Here are a few of them.
The icons for Warrior, Tinkerer, and Scout (not finalized)


PATHS
In addition to Archetypes, Players choose Paths for their Characters, which are permanent associations they make with an animal and help define what extra human Abilities they'll be able to choose from, among other effects. There are fifteen basic Paths in the core rulebook.
The Path of the Beaver, the Stag and the Spider
(See our Update for more on this)
While this game was created by a Native-led team, this game is for everyone. We've taken great care to craft a game that Natives and non-Natives alike will be able to engage in and find themselves immersed in. 
For Natives, we've crafted both story and game mechanics that will allow you to integrate your own tribal customs into your play. For those who aren't Native, you'll have a wealth of options to choose from as well as clear guidelines for understanding the differences between this world and our real one. 
The game is designed to be your first role playing game or your latest. The core rule book will walk players through every step of how to play Coyote and Crow, but also how to play role playing games in general, including advice on safety and inclusion as well as suggestions on where to find tools outside of the rule book to make your game both easier and more enjoyable.
Everyone involved in Coyote and Crow is deeply passionate about our game and we felt that it was time for Indigenous folks to have a game that didn't see them as secondary, as adversaries, or intertwined with colonialism.
Coyote and Crow is not set in a dystopia. The world went through a dark chapter, but the people of these nations rose to the challenge. There's good food and water, education and meaningful work for almost everyone in Makasing. 
But this world isn't a utopia either. It's place that's growing, where old alliances are strained and past slights are not always forgotten. New technology is putting pressure on old traditions. And with the climate becoming milder, there is a whole world of unknowns out there. On top of all of that, there are rumors that some of the old stories about monsters and spirits might just be a little more real than some originally believed. This is a game where science and the unexplained live side by side and sometimes clash.
The Wanderer. Art by Kyle Charles.

THE CORE RULE BOOK
We are producing a beautiful 300+ page hardbound book, loaded with illustrations and containing all of the rules you'll need to play Coyote and Crow. Included in the book (and PDF) will be:
Detailed history of this alternate world
Descriptions of daily life and culture in Cahokia, the capital of the Free Lands
Rules for creating and advancing your characters, including 6 Archetypes, 15 Paths and 27 Abilities for a massive variety of options
Descriptions and stats for mythical creatures, infamous spirits, shadowy organizations and dangerous cults that can challenge players endlessly
A group of pre-generated characters if you want to jump right into playing the game
A starter adventure, Encounter at Station 54, that can act as a stand alone adventure or as the start of a larger campaign
So much more!
SHIPPING
We will be shipping only to the US and Canada during this Kickstarter. In addition, we will be subsidizing a portion of the shipping costs within the Kickstarter itself to help keep costs down. If you are not in the US or Canada, not to worry. We have already partnered with traditional hobby distribution and the game will be available through your local hobby partners shortly after Kickstarter fulfillment. 
YOUR PLEDGE
 Whisperer: $5  This pledge shows your support for the project and allows you to keep abreast of all the future news about Coyote and Crow. We'll also notify you when late pledges are available after the campaign.
 Tinkerer: $20 With this pledge you get everything the Whisperer gets, plus a full color PDF version of the physical game, including all of the art. This version will be released shortly after we have sent our files to the printer and you'll have access to it before the physical copies have been delivered.
 Warrior: $50 (plus shipping)All of the benefits of both the Whisperer and the Tinkerer plus you'll get one full color hard cover edition and access to all Stretch Goals. You can choose to keep your physical copy of the book or donate it to a reservation library. If you donate, we'll handle the shipping. 
 Healer: $100 All of the benefits of Whisperer, Tinkerer, and Warrior, PLUS we'll ship a full hardcover copy of Coyote and Crow to a Native American reservation library in your honor. You pay for the shipping for your copy and we'll pay for the shipping to the reservation copy.
 Scout: $150 (plus shipping) For Friendly Local Games Stores Only. With this pledge you'll receive 6 copies of Coyote and Crow (1 case). You'll receive these at the same time as other Kickstarter backers, in advance of the general release.
 Seeker: $400 (plus shipping) (ALL GONE) For those that really want to support Coyote and Crow! All of the benefits of the Whisperer, Tinkerer, Warrior and Healer pledges, but your book will be signed and numbered by Connor Alexander. You'll also receive three high quality art prints of art used in the book (which ones, to be determined). This level is limited to 50 backers.
It still hungers. Art by Jeffrey Veregge
We have a diverse team of folks working on this game, most of whom are Native. Additionally, we are striving to bring in other marginalized voices whenever possible. Our team features people from across the LGBTQIA spectrum, including two spirit folks. It's not even a question that this game is political. If you have a problem with a game where there are no people of European descent represented, than this game is probably not for you. That said, we've truly built this game to be played by everyone. It might seem like a big leap, but don't worry, we're going to hold your hand the whole way through and you'll be so happy you stepped off the edge into this vibrant fresh world.

I'd also like to add that this is a very personal project for me. While it's the first project I've created, I've been working in the games industry for 7 years and I've been a role player since 1978. For a long time I've wanted to create a game that speaks to my Native heritage in a way that's hopeful and positive. I'm proud of the team I've assembled (and am still adding to) and I'm confident that we have the experience, talent and determination to not only complete this project and deliver, but to bring you a truly memorable role playing experience.   - Connor Alexander, creator

Especially during Covid, many games face delays out of their producers control, from development to printing and shipping. updates.update_content:
Things are moving at a break neck pace, folks. There’s so much happening that it’s hard for me to summarize it all while also conveying how cool and exciting each of these things is. So, I’m splitting this update into two parts. We’ll talk about the where we’re at with production of everything related to the Kickstarter as well as other news. Then we’ll jump in to more game development discussion.
But first! A quick note! We’ve locked down current orders. Don’t worry, you can still pre-order or make late pledges through BackerKit and we haven’t locked down addresses yet. We’ll do that much later. So if you’re moving or not sure yet where you need your personal book shipped to, you have plenty of time. Also, please fill out your surveys if you haven’t yet. There are still around 1500 of you out there. Don’t make me wag my finger.

Folks, they are here!
A few of you may have already received them and for the rest of you, they'll be sent out in waves over the next few days. If you're new to Kickstarter, you'll be receiving an email from BackerKit, the pledge manager we're working with.  Here's what's in it and what you need to know.

Greetings!
With the campaign officially wrapped and the dust settling, we're finally in a position where we can give you all some news. Happy to report that it's all good stuff!
First, I want to thank all 16,269 of you that backed Coyote & Crow. It was more than just a vote of confidence in our game, it was a clear mandate for us to move forward with taking our RPG and launching a full fledged publishing operation.

We did it folks. In just 30 days we:
Smashed through our 18k original goal in just 45 minutes
Hit all of our original stretch goals in less than a week
Made waves across gaming media
Hit the $1 million+ mark, putting us in the top 6 RPG books of all time
earmarked 5000 books for donations to reservation and tribal libraries, schools and community centers (more on that below)

updates.update_userinfo: What About The Rest of the World? (And our next stretch goal!)
updates.update_content:
Hello again!
Today, I want to talk about a topic that a few people have asked about in a variety of ways. The essence of these questions really boil down to this. What's going on in other parts of the world outside of the Americas in this alternate future? In Coyote & Crow, we focus most closely on Cahokia, our starting city. We touch on the Free Lands and the other nations of Makasing and we'll even briefly outline the nations further south in what we call Abayang and Abazang (South and Central America).

Good morning C&C friends!
We've got just 10 days left in our Kickstarter and I'm getting so excited to announce our last stretch goal later this week if we hit that mark. I'll be able to give you the name and further details on the Native author who will hopefully be writing a one shot adventure for us!
But on to the update. A friend messaged me over the weekend and was already mulling some ideas for a Saga. Saga is what we call a series of adventures or stories, in lieu of campaign, which is often used in role playing games. We felt that campaign came off as too militaristic and we thought Saga worked well with terms like Story and Session, which we also use.

Hey, friends!
I've had a number of folks ask me why we chose to go with the d12 for our system. There's a few reasons and some of them might not be what you think. I thought I'd use my update today to fill you in on some fun trivia. The d12 and the number 12 itself play important roles in both the mechanics and the world building we're doing for Coyote & Crow.

Greetings folks!
Today, I want to talk a little bit about who should be playing this game. I've seen a trickle of concern that Coyote and Crow is something non-Natives shouldn't bring to their table. Before I get into how we've handled this situation in the text of the game itself, I wanted to share my broader thoughts on the topic.

Hey folks,
Just a quick update. Today we hit another tremendous milestone. Thank you all so much for your continued generosity and support. Our whole crew is elated over the response to their work and we're all so excited to finish what we've started.
I also have  a slightly embarrassing situation to address. A very kind person pointed out that our icon for the Warrior was almost identical to the modern icon used in Black Power messaging. This was entirely an error on my part. I used a placeholder mock-up instead of our final icon and we've since remedied that. You can see the actual icon for the Warrior in the current image on the Campaign page. The icon that was there previously was an internal use only illustration that was meant as a developmental reference and was never intended for print.  I apologize to anyone who was confused or concerned, and I truly hope there was no offense caused.  We have the deepest respect for our Black allies and our icon was always meant as a nod to them.

As someone of Puerto Rican descent, I love that you guys already have plans for Central and South America (and hopefully the Caribbean too?). Having only recently learned about the Taino peoples I'm excited for the possibilities for this setting. I know it's a long time away, but I assume you'd be looking at bringing in writers of Hispanic and Latin American heritage for that material?

Also, I sincerely hope I'm not coming off as argumentative. I truly believe that the goals behind this RPG are extraordinarily important, and I think we might actually be on the same page and I have different immediate cultural associations with the terms Hispanic and Latin America than you do. (As I mentioned, I thought cultures like the Aztec, Inca, and Maya fall under the umbrella of Central and South America.)

However, while the cultural genocide of Central and South America was one of the most successful in history, the people of those countries still have predominantly indigenous roots. In other words, we're still here, though due to discrimination, some indigenous ancestors may have decided to leave their roots behind, and leave no clues for descendants. I may not know if I have Nahua, Chorotega, or maybe even Chibcha roots, but I still know I'm indigenous! Nevertheless, you will still find pure indigenous tribes in every Latin American country who continue to practice their traditions; I'm not just referring to uncontacted Amazonian tribes! In Nicaragua alone, there are 7 indigenous groups recognized by the government with populations ranging from 2,000 to 200,000+. And even with groups like the Taino, who experienced a more complete genocide, and more than 80% of the Taino were killed, there still remain Taino people and historians who are practicing and preserving their heritage. In short, a few tribes may not have living practitioners, but that's what written records and anthropologists are for, and you don't want to underestimate the number of tribes and groups still out there. So not to worry! I think we can leave this to those more versed in Native and Indigenous history than ourselves. It sounds like the Coyote & Crow folks know what they're doing and I have full faith in them!

campaign.story:
Hellboy has appeared in countless graphic novels and comic books, prose novels and short story collections, acclaimed role playing games and video games, three live action films and two animated features, and has inspired toys and collectibles. Now it’s time for award-winning Hellboy creator Mike Mignola to get his turn in the spotlight in the all new documentary MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS, the definitive story of one of the most influential and important comic book creators of all time. 
MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is a feature-length film that tells the story of how Mike Mignola came to create a world-renowned comic book universe.  The film includes never-before-seen interviews conducted with the legendary creator at his studio, drawing demonstrations, behind the scenes footage from workshops and comic book conventions, and interviews with some of the most influential people in entertainment. 
As one of the most successful independent comic book creators, Mignola has inspired generations of writers and artists. This film provides an in-depth look at his legacy, from the beginning of his career to his success with Hellboy. We are already well in to production and are here on Kickstarter asking for YOUR help to finish this film! 
"Mike Mignola has built a huge comic book universe around the character on par with what Stan Lee and Jack Kirby accomplished with Marvel Comics" - The AV Club
Featuring interviews with Mike Mignola, Neil Gaiman, Rebecca Sugar, Doug Jones, Victor LaValle, Guillermo del Toro, Vanessa Eichholz, Joe Quesada, Vita Ayala, Adam Savage, Tara McPherson, Prof. Ben Saunders, Mike Richardson, Tom Sniegoski, Katii O'Brien, Christopher Golden, Chris Roberson and more. Featuring interviews and art demos by Mike Mignola, Duncan Fegredo, Mike Oeming, Dave Stewart and Jason Shawn Alexander.
Rewards
  We want to make supporting this film a special experience for our backers, EVERY REWARD IN THIS CAMPAIGN IS EXCLUSIVE TO OUR BACKERS, except for the regular edition Blu-Ray!That's right, when we says Kickstarter Exclusive, we mean it! The only thing available to purchase after the campaign will be the Blu-Ray!
Rewards
Pledge Tiers
Stretch Goals
Original Art Tiers
Why Back Now?
MIKE MIGNOLA: DRAWING MONSTERS is being directed and produced by Jim Demonakos (co-founder, Emerald City Comic Con and LightBox Expo) and Kevin Konrad Hanna (Director, Clockwork Girl). We love comics. We love Mignola. We are committed to making an in depth, top-shelf documentary film, and we already have over 80 hours of footage that we have shot over the last year and a half.
 Help Make The Documentary - This is the most important part - you! We need YOUR financial support to help finish this documentary by conducting additional interviews throughout the country, plus hiring a professional editor and sound designer to get the final film ready to release. By backing us now, we can use the funds you pledge to make this documentary about Mike Mignola that is truly something special.
 Exclusive Rewards - We have created all kinds of exclusives for this campaign, and except for the Blu-Ray of the film, everything else is a backer exclusive just for you! We wanted the rewards to be something special, so by backing, you'll get rewards not available at any other time!
 Join The Journey - Be the first to hear news and share your thoughts as you follow our process of creating the documentary through to its completion.
Ready join the journey? Please back now!
Timeline
Mike Mignola: Drawing Monsters  is already in production. Filming will continue and is scheduled to be done in the fall/winter of 2021, with the finished film debuting by spring of 2022! For reward fulfillment, we are working with the team at White Squirrel to make sure everything is professionally delivered to you.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! It’s been a month since the close of the campaign, the funds have been received from Kickstarter and we wanted to send out a short update!
First, we wanted to let you know that Adam F. Goldberg (the creator of the hit sitcom The Goldbergs) has come on board the documentary. He has produced numerous documentaries surrounding geek culture, including The Orange Years: The Nickelodeon Story (on Hulu), Power of Grayskull: The Definitive History of He-Man and the Masters of the Universe (on Netflix), Fanboys, 30 Years of Garbage: The Garbage Pail Kids Story and more. We’re really excited to have someone with this much experience on board to continue to help make a reality.

updates.update_userinfo: You Did It!! The Campaign Is Over and We Love You!
updates.update_content:
You did it! This month has been a wild ride and we are so humbled to announce that our very last stretch goal was unlocked and that this campaign surpassed the $500,000 mark! It is absolutely incredible what you all have done, and what you are allowing us to do, thank you to every single one of you amazing 4,652 backers!
Aside from all the amazing stuff that you’ve helped unlock, this funding is going directly to help us create a documentary about Mike Mignola that is truly worthy of his legacy.

updates.update_userinfo: 36 Hours To Go and Our FINAL Stretch Goal Announced!!
updates.update_content:
With just 36 hours left in this campaign, we hit our stretch goal from yesterday which means we can announce our FINAL GIANT STRETCH GOAL!!
Since the campaign took off, we have been working on something we think is super cool for our final goal, and so we’ve spent the last few weeks talking to different manufacturers to make it happen, and now, here it is:

updates.update_userinfo: 3 Days Left + Another Stretch Goal Announced!
updates.update_content: Hi everyone, we hope you had a great weekend! We did, as you all helped us hit our previous stretch goal! So, with just 3 days left in this campaign, we’re very excited to announce our next stretch goal!

updates.update_userinfo: 2 New Interviewees and Another Stretch Goal Too!
updates.update_content:
Happy Friday everyone! We unlocked our previous stretch goal, thanks to your amazing support! You might have seen the news on social media, but we wanted to let you know that we have added TWO more people who have committed to be interviewed for the documentary!
First off, there’s JORGE R. GUTIERREZ, who directed the animated film The Book of Life (currently playing on Disney+) and created El Tigre for Nick. Jorge has been inspired by Mignola for his whole art career, and he even had one of his characters from El Tigre, named Frida, wear red goggles as an homage to Hellboy!

updates.update_userinfo: 2 New Original Art tiers + Another New Goal!
updates.update_content: Holy cannoli, you all absolutely blew away our last stretch goal! The excitement for the Deck of Doom card was amazing and we’re so thrilled to be able to bring that card to life! On to our next stretch goal!

Happy Monday! All of you wonderful backers came together and unlocked the 2-Disc Blu-Ray upgrade! We’re so excited to share all the amazing mini featurettes and other cool stuff we have planned for you!
Have any of you played the Hellboy Board Game? We're big fans as we think it's pretty awesome, and we thought it would be cool to tie the board game in to what we're doing here. Turns out, our new friends at Mantic Games were super open to a collaboration and we’ve been working together to create our very next stretch goal!

updates.update_userinfo: New Original Art Tier + A Huge New Goal!
updates.update_content: Holy Heck! We don’t know what to say other than thank you, you all are amazing! Because of your enthusiastic support, we’ve unlocked the previously announced stretch goals (all the rewards related to Matt Smith’s Hellboy piece plus the “Hellboy Cosplayers and Collectors” mini featurette). With those being unlocked, that means we can reveal a big new stretch goal!

Hi everyone! Since our last update, we hit both our stretch goals at $290k (unlocking all the rewards related to David Petersen’s Hellboy piece) and at $300k (unlocking the mini promo movie poster). Because of your amazing support, we’re going to announce another two stretch goals this time!

campaign.story:
Danielle is a roadie for a touring heavy metal festival. After receiving a call informing her that her estranged mother is dying, Danielle leaves the tour, hopefully in time patch things up with her mom before the end. Driving through the desert in her Panther Pink 1971 Dodge Demon, she notices some unsettling visual cues. Thinking it's because she's running on too little sleep, she pulls into a roadside motel for the night. In the middle of the night, the clerk turns into a demon and invades her room.
After that things get weird. 
Over the course of the series, 1 - 4, Danielle learns that Satan himself has trapped her in Hell so she can help him reclaim his stolen throne from a usurper, another fallen angel. It's got something to do with a mysterious object in a blue case, a dead gun-runner, Aleister Crowley, a cursed weapon imbued with the trauma of a million murders, and one super cool Panther Pink 1971 Demon powered by Chrysler's infamous "Slant 6" engine, a motor renown for its durability.
Pure grindhouse pulp-horror, Hellbound Slant 6 combines a few of my favorite things; cool cars, heavy metal, the devil, and bad-ass women. The whole aesthetic is White Zombie, I'm talking La Sexorcisto: Devil Music Volume 1 and Astro-Creep vibes, all the way down. I recommend reading Danielle's adventure through Hell while listening to Thunderkiss '65, Creature of the Wheel, and of course, Black Sunshine. 
I was a bright-eyed and bushy tailed lad fresh out of high school when I wrote, penciled, and inked the original comic. Then I wrote and thumbnailed the next two issues. Then, life happened. Every few years, I'd return to the comic, which I called "To Hell and Back," deciding I needed to re-draw the entire thing, getting only a few pages in before other things got in the way. 
20 years later, it's time to finish the story. I've never done a crowd-funding campaign before, but this one has modest goals. Here goes!

campaign.story:
Current goal: £2750 | Unlocks Special Previously Unreleased Fantasy Origin Story...
Our tale begins in 2014...
Back when Ygritte was still in Game of Thrones, before Guardians of the Galaxy came out, or Drake released Hotline Bling...
In Sheffield, UK, two fresh-faced actors straight out of a performing arts course set out to make their own opportunities. They teamed up with a likeminded DoP and put all their worldly money towards a fantasy feature film [pictured below], made with goodwill and steep learning curves... this formed the first steps into their world of Myrlan. Following their first taste of filmmaking, the team formed Pale Raven Pictures and dove into writing the 126-page draft for the sequel - for some time, that's as far as this world got.
A few short films and award-winning music videos later, the fantasy world of Myrlan calls again - this time with 4 years of training and experience in writing and directing, not to mention a rich research into medieval combat techniques. Now, with our incredible cast and devoted team all working for the love of the project, we can bring life to Myrlan like never before. How much of the world we can show... is up to you.
From "Blessed" - Pale Raven Pictures, 2016
 This is a standalone short film.
There are no hidden secrets or references to past manifestations, this is the standalone first chapter of Myrlan's story. We have chewed over many imaginings of the land and its narratives: our world-building has spanned the 6 years since our first film, resulting in two feature screenplays, five short screenplays and a short story - these build a deep reference for the vivid world we present now, in Myrlan.
Where we go next is untold... a feature film? Series? We have plans that will lead us to those conversations, with this film as our credentials. You can be sure you're playing a hand in the birth of a grand story.
"Myrlan" development - background to the story and inspiration references for people and costume.
 All funds for this project go straight into production and distribution.
Any funds we receive will be visible in the film: a costume, an axe, a shield, a tankard... Or be used for the film's visibility, by entry into film festivals - a commitment we make to promote all artists involved in Myrlan.
Our pitch is simple: everyone working on this project is a volunteer in their professional role. Many will be balancing this against day jobs and other professional work in acting or filmmaking and we are overwhelmed with the devotion and support we've already received from our team. We do not expect artists to work for exposure on feature productions, however, short films don't make money, they cost money. They are an investment in the careers of the artists involved. As the production company we have the responsibility to deliver our actors, stunt performers, camera persons, composer, make-up artists, costume designers and art department a career milestone that is worthy of their dedication and time.
The duty of Pale Raven Pictures is to "springboard artists into the arts industry". We are working with keen and incredibly talented artists breaking into one of the world's toughest industries (especially after the events of 2020!) - backing this project is investing in the careers of over 40 independent artists.
From "Alone" - Pale Raven Pictures, 2018 [click to view]
About the Director and Co-writer, Cieran.
Part of the co-writing duo behind all Pale Raven's fantasy projects, Cieran writes non-stop. As an independent writer, he has a feature screenplay and 10 shorts under his belt - one recently selected as Semi-Finalist in a screenwriting award.
He's fascinated with world-building and loves actors to be able to work in a day-dream where the film world becomes their reality... From his own training in acting, he has an eye for performance and a good hunch for casting, which proved useful when considering over 300 applications for parts in Myrlan..!
Cieran [right] on the set of a Viking combat showcase, 2019 [click to view]
About the Producer and Co-writer, Dale.
Dale has written, directed and performed in independent theatre productions, as well as producing and co-writing a number of films for Pale Raven Pictures. He trained for 4 years in acting, honing transformative character performances. He has worked professionally as an actor for scare attractions, adverts, educational videos and even hosts a pub quiz or two.
Dale's passion is historical combat. He trained for 5 years in HEMA (Historical European Martial Arts) and 1 year with the Viking Society, choreographing numerous fight scenes. Dale's goal in Myrlan is to make the combat scenes as realistic and as adrenaline-fuelled as possible.
Dale on the set of our award-winning music video "Big Noise" which he produced and co-directed [click to view]
We have already started shooting.
Production has commenced on test shoots and some preliminary scenes. We aim to shoot the majority of the film in MARCH 2021 and have a finished film by AUGUST 2021.
As 2020 has taught us, things have been hard to set in stone. Cieran has trained extensively in Covid-compliance filmmaking, and is a qualified Covid Co-ordinator with First Option Ltd. He has already shot a short film during national lockdown, following health & safety guidelines to the letter and imagining creative solutions for transmission-prevention beyond just using PPE.
Beer tent, on the set of "Myrlan", 2020
Have a look at how backing can build our story...
We have the tenacity to go ahead with production no matter what funds we have. Whether we exceed our goal or fall short, we'll still deliver you a great film - but you can bring it to life. With each goal achieved, we will curate the content of every frame to fit our budget and fully immerse you in Myrlan.
 Current goal: £2750 | Unlocks Special Previously Unreleased Fantasy Origin Story...
*To make budgets more fun, special content is unlocked in each level. Reaching the current goal of £2750 unlocks a special, unreleased origin story that we shot back in 2018... We never found the right time to share this story, so step with us into the glades of Serpent's Head and a young lord's past...This will include thanks to all our new backers at the time of reaching that goal.
If you wish to back us anonymously and you're using a Kickstarter account, you can do this by changing your name in your profile settings. If we reach our goal and you backed using a guest account, we will contact you via the email you provide to request the name you wish to use.
It can be hard to imagine the effects of budgets, so we've expanded on it below:
With Cuts - £ Goal Not Reached At this level we would cut larger scenes from the film and re-write around these sections with less demanding sequences. We would lose a major fight scene and re-shoot a dialogue section to condense two scenes into one.
Performance Focused - £450 At this level we would focus intimately on the performances of our great cast. The film would be shot closer in, to avoid focus on set dressing, costume and location, and would have smaller fight scenes. It may play closer to a drama and explore inter-character relationships further.
Character Focused - £800 Here we would have the liberty to explore the characters in Myrlan in more depth, creating unique costume items and props for them as well as additional supporting cast.
Story Focused - £1500 At the heart of Myrlan is its story. With this kind of support we would be able to access and dress bigger, bolder locations - showcasing Yorkshire's finest heritage sites. These will include long art department days, building the best environments for our actors to immerse themselves in Myrlan.
World Focused - £2750 Welcome to Myrlan. This backing will create the world of Myrlan as fully formed as it is in our script. If battle-ready swords and castles weren't enough, we'd also have the capacity to expand some scenes - including grander fights and an introduction to our capital city, Heim.
Expanding Horizons - £2750+ This support puts Myrlan into a whole different conversation. What we've set out to achieve with modest budgets can be imagined on a grander scale and make an unforgettable impression. We can go down paths we thought inaccessible, exploring visual effects, specialist equipment and admissions to prestigious film festivals. 
The heart of our efforts is to support all artists involved in Myrlan and put them in the spotlight for their incredible work.
"Myrlan" budget breakdown - we will update regularly on how we are distributing your support.
Thanks for taking the time to read.
We appreciate any support you may be able to give, from backing us to simply watching the film we create. By sharing this project online, by word of mouth or sending a raven to anyone you think might be interested, you are already supporting us, and we will raise a mug of mead in your honour when wrap night ("wrap-narok") comes!
We look forward to welcoming you to Myrlan in 2021
Dale in a camera test for "Myrlan", 2020
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will go ahead with production no matter what funds we have. Whether we exceed our goal or fall short, we'll still deliver you a great film - but you can bring it to life. With each goal achieved, we will curate the content of every frame to fit our budget and fully immerse you in Myrlan.
Our timeline will have to fit around government restrictions involving filming during the Covid-19 pandemic, however we believe with proper preparation, this shouldn't restrict us. Weather and locations are moving parts that we have less control over and can be unpredictable, changing at the last minute. We are usually well equipped to avoid this affecting our shoot, but it's possible re-shooting or location access could cause delays.
Like any project, this is live and will be updated as we progress through to delivery. We want to keep our backers involved with the project every step of the way and will flag any challenges and how we're combating them as they arise.

Myrlan is successfully funded!
Congratulations to everyone, with your support in backing, sharing and believing in this project this lockdown labour of love has become a fully funded film that will be carved in the stone tablets of history. Well, in the independent fantasy scene at least!

Our Kickstarter will complete this Sunday at 3pm GMT!
We're amazed with how much we've been supported by this awesome community of backers. Whether familiar to our projects or newly discovering them, all of you are now part of this film's journey and we will keep sharing news as it's made!

Streaming release confirmed! + Last week of funding!
We're thrilled to announce that Myrlan will be released with The Fantasy Network - an awesome online platform for independent fantasy content - available online and IOS/Google Play app stores.

Amazing news! At only halfway through we have reached our third stretch goal!
Wow. The support behind this project so far has been incredible. We're particularly amazed that all three of our highest pledge rewards have been claimed - Executive Producers, skål! It is a testament to the belief in the creatives working on this film and the appreciation of the fantasy genre.

campaign.story:
*desperately* click! click!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians battle the Lady of Chains when her enforcers march down from the frosty north. They rocket through the stars to safeguard diplomats ending a generations-old conflict. They sip tea together and share shy glances at the corner cafe with their old classmates and comrades. Even when swords are crossed, they have the potential to connect more deeply than anyone expects.
A sword duel can end in kissing, a witch can gain her power by helping others find love, and an entire campaign can be built around vagabond matchmakers piloting their sentient gay spaceship from system to system.
If you love angsty disaster lesbians with swords, you have come to the right place.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians by April Kit Walsh is a roleplaying game that celebrates the love, power, and existence of queer people—specifically queer people with swords and a lot of feelings. Flirting, sword-fighting, and barbed zingers all mix together in a system designed for both narrative drama and player safety. This innovative take on the Powered by the Apocalypse engine is a breeze to learn and ensures that no matter how the dice fall, something interesting happens to move the story forward.
In this game, you will solve problems with wit, empathy, and style, fight when something is worth fighting for, and redeem (or seduce) at least a few of your adversaries. You’re part of a community that embodies important ideals and you’ll strive to protect it and make your world better.
Play as one of nine character types: Beast, Chosen, Devoted, Infamous, Nature Witch, Scoundrel, Seeker, Spooky Witch, and Trickster. Each explores a particular emotional conflict that drives the drama and shapes your character’s story. Are you a Beast, faced with the dilemma of expressing your inner truth versus fitting in to a society that demands you conform? A Devoted, who sacrifices for others while struggling to care for yourself? A Trickster, who craves closeness but fears vulnerability? In long-term play, you may even resolve your initial arc and advance into a different playbook as you continue to change and grow, facing new challenges.
Backers get immediate access to the playbooks too. They're form fillable!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians provides clear, robust guidance and support for running the game, including how to make appealing adversaries, set the tone, structure play, and create a safe environment at the table. Handy reference sheets help you narrate appropriate twists and drama on the fly, depending on the feelings and character types you have in play.
Want to jump into a one-shot? The game includes six adventures that can stand alone or kick off a longer series: Sword Lesbians of the Three Houses, Best Day of Their Lives, Constellation Festival, Gal Paladins, and Monster Queers of Castle Gayskull. For even more inspiration, it features The Starcross Galaxy campaign setting along with five more settings from these contributing authors:
 Lesbeans Coffehouse by Dominique Dickey
 Neon City 2099 by Jamila Nedjadi
 The Three Orders of Ardor by Whitney Delaglio
 Les Violettes Dangereuses by Jonaya Kemper
 Yuisa Revolution by Alexis Sara
We also provide ample guidance on how to create your own tales of fighting with swords and falling in love, along with a world building worksheet, variant rules, and a set of starting scenario seeds to play with. Because the game focuses on feelings and relationships, it’s a lens you can use to play in a variety of genres. If you like slashfic of characters with swords, you’ll love this game.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians is explicitly designed to tell melodramatic and queer stories; tales fraught with relationship triangles, mystery, intrigue, relationship anarchy, celebration, and revolution. It includes rules to highlight different identities, emotional connections, and setting elements.
This game is not for fascists, TERFs, or other bigots. The team behind Thirsty Sword Lesbians supports racial liberation, intersectional feminism, and queer liberation. We love and respect transgender people, nonbinary people, intersex people, and women. This game is a joyous celebration of lives and identities otherwise marginalized. If you don’t agree, fix your heart before sharing a table with other people.
What if... not Thirsty? The game fundamentally assumes that the characters crave connection, but that connection doesn’t need to be sexual or romantic. We offer you options for changing how the game addresses connection in our variant rules section.
What if... not Swords? It’s simple enough to swap out a different hand-to-hand combat option. Your campaign or your character can use a labrys, the double-bladed axe that became a lesbian icon in the late 20th century. You can use different styles of unarmed combat or even grapple using telepathic self-projections. It’s also possible to replace the swords with mecha, starships, or guns, but it requires some thought and the book will help you think about how to ensure that it stays intimate and relationship-focused. The conflict doesn’t have to be physically violent, either; you can use any kind of conflict that’s adrenaline-inducing and close-quarters.
What if... not Lesbians? We’ll let you in on a secret: you don’t have to play a lesbian. The game plays with themes that are common for all sorts of people who are marginalized on the basis of gender and sexuality, as well as feelings that go beyond the queer experience. If you want to play thirsty sword cishets, we’re not going to stop you—just don’t be surprised if the game turns them queer.
What if... I’m not good at flirting or zingers? You don’t have to be witty or good at flirting in real life to play a character with those skills, and not every character in Thirsty Sword Lesbians is good with words. Shy and awkward sword lesbians find love, too. You’ll find them well-represented in this game.
Ready? Let’s Go!
Click for a PDF of this graph!
Wondering what’s involved in all those delicious bullet-points on that reward tier you’ve been flirting with? Here are your answers (scroll further down to find out about the many stretch goals already unlocked—look for the big glass)!



Angsty disaster lesbians, here and now! You can find details about the production timeline in the project's FAQ.
After the campaign is over (possibly a few months down the road) we'll launch a BackerKit for this campaign and invite the backers to set up your rewards.
BackerKit is a pledge manager: a separate website that gives you (and us!) greater control over what happens after the campaign than a simple survey would.
Based on our average shipping scenario in the USA, we're charging a flat $10 fee (media mail + handling costs) for book shipments to USA addresses.
BIG NEWS as of October 19th! Thanks to a big show of support from our friends at the UK-based Mongoose Publishing, we are now able to offer shipping outside the USA for this Kickstarter. Right now we have the Smitten (all flavors) and Nice tiers set up to offer shipping for $15 to destinations in Australia, Canada, the European Union, Japan, New Zealand, the Philippines, and the United Kingdom. We would be happy to add your location as well! 
Please contact us at feedback@evilhat.com if it looks like your destination is not yet covered, and we'll add it as an option as soon as we confirm the shipping rate for that country/region.
If you end up ordering multiple books for international shipment, we will bill an additional $5 per additional item in BackerKit well after the campaign is done.
April Kit Walsh (she/her or ze/zir) writes queer games about feelings, vulnerability, and caring for one another. She used to be a swordfighting ballerina, but claims those days are behind her; she has absolutely no idea who that masked heroine with the sword and the tutu might be. You can find April's games at GaySpaceship.com and on Twitter at @GaySpaceshipGms. When not writing RPGs, April is a civil liberties attorney working to protect the rights of activists, journalists, and everyone else impacted by technologies of control or of empowerment.
Avery Alder (she/her) is a queer designer hailing from Sinixt territory. She's the designer of Monsterhearts, The Quiet Year, Dream Askew, Ribbon Drive, and a host of smaller, scrappier projects. In her design and play, she gravitates toward the moody, the personal, and the transformative.
Whitney Marie Delaglio (she/her) is a game designer, artist, and creator of the brand Little Wish Productions. Her aquatic roleplaying game, Prism, focuses on sensuality, relationships, and conflict resolution. As a support class in the gaming community, she is an advocator of providing a safe space for intimacy, emotional vulnerability, and non-toxic bro culture.
Alexis Sara (she/her) is a multiple award winning comics writer and a massive lover of Tabletop RPGs. She works in every form of media she can telling stories of her fellow sapphics, trans folks and more overcoming great odds and falling in love. You can find Alexis's lesbian Latinx works over at @transcomics on twitter.
Dominique Dickey (they/them) is a writer, editor, cultural consultant, and all-around RPG hooligan. They love tea, naps, and dogs, and are inordinately proud to be a third generation Angeleno. More of their fiction and game design work can be found at dominiquedickey.com. They tweet as @DomSDickey.
Jonaya Kemper (she/they) is an activist, educator, and designer with a passion for transformational games. A deep fan of reimagining history, they hope that other will have as much fun imagining themselves in a floating Steamfunk fantasy as she did. Her game writing can be found in #Feminism, Honey and Hot Wax: an Anthology of Erotic Games, Visigoths vs. Mall Goths, The Ultimate Micro RPG Book, North Sea Legends, Kids on Bikes, and 7th Sea: Lands of Gold and Fire among her work in international larp and games academia. She has two cats who silently judge her, a plant obsessed spouse, and new feder to practice her beginning swordskills. 
Jamila R. Nedjadi (they/them) is the creative force behind Sword Queen Games and they believe in the power and magic of creative play. Their game BALIKBAYAN: Returning Home was nominated for the IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Award for best setting. Jammi is also a co-host of The Gauntlet podcast, a community podcast that focuses on play and indie TTRPGs. Jammi's sword is drawn from their revolutionary heart and showers the battle arena with purple roses! 
Lucian Kahn (he/him) is an award-winning game designer and gay-coded villain. His games include Visigoths vs Mall Goths (nominee for Best Writing, ENnie Awards 2020), Dead Friend: A Game of Necromancy (nominee for Most Innovative, IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Awards 2019) and If I Were a Lich, Man (winner for Most Innovative, IGDN 2020). Lucian co-edited Honey & Hot Wax: An Anthology of Erotic Art Games (with Sharang Biswas, published by Pelgrane Press, funded by grants from The Effing Foundation for Sex Positivity), which contains his surrealist game In the Clefts of the Rock. Follow him on twitter at @oh_theogony.
Allie Bustion is an award-winning freelance narrative designer and writer working on independent projects of their own, like HEIST and Misbehavin’, as well as titles for Paizo, Wizards of the Coast, and Guildhall Studios. They have a deep love of storytelling, fiction, pro wrestling, Final Fantasy XIV, and popular media analysis. Sometimes, those even come together. Like now.
Pam Punzalan, aka Pammu, is a queer designer, editor, sensitivity consultant and #RPGSEA community point person based in Manila. She's been published under Shadow Operations for Spire, and is involved in multiple projects big and small. Her biggest personal release isSundo: We, Once Mortal, a PbtA game about psychopomps rebelling against a world that has lied to them about the truth of their nature. Some of the things in development that she can talk about are a Dagger Isles supplement for Blades in the Dark, world building for The Islands of Sina Una, and game design for Mnemonic: Weaver's Almanac.
Libby Horacek is a game designer and software developer in West Virginia. Besides games, she loves drawing and roller skating. Her latest game is Derby Drama, inspired by her time skating with the Ohio Valley Roller Girls.
Mariam Ahmad (they/them) is a queer game designer, podcaster and streamer whose current project is writing Sarzameen, a South Asian fantasy setting. They are the GM of The Musafirs podcast, cast member of Prism Pals, and recently launched a BIMPoC community channel, Huetopia. They also love talking about food, decolonization and cats. 
Ash Cheshire (fae/fem) is a queer trans game designer and artist living in the bay area of northern California. Faer games can be found at ashcangames.itch.io or you can support faer ongoing work and receive exclusive access to experimental & pre-published games by joining the Cheshire Crew at patreon.com/ashcheshire  
Ash Kreider is a queer trans game designer, publisher, and sometimes-blogger living in the wilds of Canada with a child, a spouse, two slightly broken cats, and a snake. In addition to publishing their own games, they have also freelanced for companies like Pelgrane Press, Wizards of the Coast, and Onyx Path. Ash is also the author of Go Make Me a Sandwich, a once-popular feminist gaming blog, and do a lot of work to hold and create space for marginalized people in games.
Known mostly as a GM, Bryanna Hitchcock occasionally dabbles in game design and writing, including contributions to the Tome of Mysteries and Threadbare RPG. She is also the author of Empire City Adventures, a Fate superheroes supplement. Besides playing games, Bryanna loves playing guitar, rocking out to music, and cooking. She lives in California with her wife and two adorable cats.
James Mendez Hodes is an ENnie Award-winning cultural consultant and game designer whom you might know from Thousand Arrows, Scion, or some articles complaining about orcs and racism. You can find him online at jamesmendezhodes.com and on Twitter @LulaVampiro. His favorite She-Ra and the Princesses of Power character is Scorpia.
Kira Magrann is a queer nonbinary tabletop roleplaying game designer and snake friend living in Columbus, Ohio. The creator of A Cozy Den (a cozy game of lesbisnakes in winter time) and Something Is Wrong Here (an uncanny emotional love letter to David Lynch's work), Kira also has a Patreon that details current game design thoughts. Kira also co-curates the biweekly More Seats at the Table which is a newsletter featuring game makers of marginalized genders. Follow @Kiranansi on twitter. Games at Serpent Cyborg Games.
Ajey is a game designer of the BOLT RPG Engine, a fast and tactical toolbox RPG! He writes about game design on the #TabletopChopShop hashtag, and he reviews games on the #AjeyReads hashtag! He’s also done writing for Wanderhome and is a lightning mage in his free time.
Amr Ammourazz (They/She) is an all around nerd, with interests in everything from game design to audio fiction to mathematics and computer engineering. You can hear more about her various exploits in making everything more queer and Egyptian over at @ammourazz on twitter, such as being Co-Designer of the Chimera RPG.
Jan Martin (they/them) is a Mi'kmaw Writer living in New Brunswick, Canada. Their work explores themes of Capitalism and Colonialism through an Indigenous lens. They most recently have contributed to Starfinder Society Season 3-11: Into the Veskarium, UNCONQUERED by Monkey's Paws Games, and contributed Golden Watch Club to The Short Games Digest: Volume 5 by San Jenaro Co-Op. They are currently working on writing game content and the Original Sound Track for Monster Care Squad by Sandy Pug Games. They run Scraps Burgers, a fictional AI operated fast food empire that's actually a publisher of games. Coming soon is their debut release "Employee of the Year", an Anthology featuring five incredible designers and one lifesaver of an artist. Find them on twitter @hellotenbear or https://www.tenbear.com/
Katherine Alejandra Cross is a translatina scholar of the virtual who yearns for the robot uprising. While working on her PhD at the University of Washington iSchool, she has written extensive social criticism of gaming and tech, published sci-fi short stories, and contributed to numerous tabletop RPGs, including Pathfinder and Eclipse Phase. She lives in Seattle with her partner and two cats.
Soup (they/them) is a nonbinary, Korean-American game designer who releases approximately one game every human century or so. They love writing, food, and writing about food. You can find their personal work at literalsoup.com, their hot-blooded mech rivalry game Pyrewaltz:Love is Coming Again in the Ultimate Micro-RPG Book, or their freelance work scattered throughout various Paizo products and kickstarters (like this one).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a great team on this project. Evil Hat is an experienced RPG publisher. We've run over a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns and we've printed many roleplaying games in a variety of physical formats over the past few years.

This puts us in a fine position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise. Experience tells us that things don’t always go as planned.

Here's what we can anticipate as potential problems.

The Text: While Thirsty Sword Lesbians is largely done aside from the art and other polishing touches, it's possible backers will identify some glaring issue that we need to address before we take this fully to publication. That can add time, for sure. Luckily we have several talented writers available if we need a fix, as well as layout and editing people on standby, so any necessary changes should proceed quickly.

Printing: We have a strong, established relationship with our printers. We’ve got them on tap to print the books in whatever quantity we end up needing. But printers can run into problems all the same: supply shortages, unexpected delays due to company holidays or industry events, shipping problems, printing errors, and so on. We’ve got the experience to stay atop those potential problems and the flexibility to pivot and address them promptly. In the event of defective product, we will send a replacement at no cost to you. We print our books in the USA, so there's less of a chance the economic policies of the current administration will suddenly cause the cost of the book to skyrocket or otherwise introduce problems getting the books from the printer to us.

Shipping: Packages get lost. We'll send replacements. Shipping can take longer than expected. We won't put the book on sale until all backer copies are shipped out. Shipping costs can end up higher than expected. We'll absorb the overage.

Finances: While Evil Hat has seen some leaner months more recently, we've made the necessary cuts to our expenses to make sure we can sustain the company throughout 2020 and 2021. Also, we've already invested time and money to get Thirsty Sword Lesbians to this point with no pending expenses on the project outside of the ones we're funding here. Our bank account continues to look plenty healthy. If an unexpected cost arises, we've got the cushion to take the hit.

We often run a couple Kickstarters per year. This is a carefully planned process based on our 14+ successful Kickstarters in the past. Because Kickstarter fulfillment takes time, these campaigns can overlap. When it happens, that's something we plan for extensively. We make space for each Kickstarter, fulfillment, and distribution release in our schedule, and we work to ensure that resources are available to take each of our projects across the finish line.

If there's any risk or challenge YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible. We intend to impress you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Constelación is a quarterly speculative fiction bilingual magazine, publishing stories in both Spanish and English. Writers can submit their stories in either language. Fifty percent of the stories we publish in every issue will be from authors from the Caribbean, Latin America, and their diaspora. 
Constelación es una revista especulativa multilengual cuatrimestral que publica historias en español y en inglés. Los escritores pueden enviar sus cuentos en cualquiera de los dos idiomas. Cincuenta porciento de las historias que publicamos en cada edición será de autores del Caribe, Latinoamérica y sus diásporas.
It was a cold autumn night in Asunción, Paraguay, and a grey spring afternoon in Washington State. Dream Foundry was hosting its first online convention, and Coral spent the day working on running the convention spaces, hosting the meetings, and moderating channels. Eliana kept screaming internally about how happy she was to be able to attend an online SFF convention. After a long day of great panels and a lot of coffee for Coral, the two happened to be in one of the voice chats and they began to talk. 
A few weeks later, an anonymous person sponsored Eliana for SFWA's Nebulas. The two met again in one of the breakout rooms where the Nebula winners were celebrating. The conversation steered towards the topic of SFF and Spanish, and how there were very few online spaces where people who wrote in Spanish could publish short fiction (and get paid for it!)  
Coral contacted Eliana the following week and asked her what she thought about doing an online bilingual magazine, one that would publish stories in both English and Spanish. Eliana had already toyed with the idea before, so she immediately said yes. 
The kindness of strangers, a little luck, and the amazing people who brought up the topic led to the creation of Constelación Magazine, a bilingual speculative fiction magazine. 
Era una noche fría de otoño en Asunción, Paraguay, y una tarde gris de primavera en el estado de Washington. Dream Foundry llevaba acabo su primera convención online, y Coral se pasó el día trabajando. Eliana no paraba de gritar internamente por lo feliz que estaba de participar en una convención de SFF online. Tras un largo día de paneles geniales, y mucho café para Coral, las dos se encontraron en uno de los canales de voz y empezaron a charlar. 
Unas semanas después, una persona anónima sponsoreo a Eliana para que asista a los Nebulas, organizado por SFWA. Las dos volvieron a encontrarse en una de las salas de Zoom donde los ganadores del premio estaban celebrando. La conversación giró en torno al tema de SFF en español, y cómo había pocos lugares online donde la gente que escribe en el idioma pudiera publicar cuentos (¡y recibir remuneración por ello!). 
Coral le escribió a Eliana la siguiente semana, y le preguntó qué pensaba de la idea de hacer una revista online bilingüe que publicara historias en inglés y español. Eliana ya había tenido una idea similar, así que inmediatamente dijo que sí. 
Un buen gesto anónimo, un poco de suerte, y las personas geniales que hablaron del tema llevaron a que nazca Constelación Magazine, una revista de ficción especulativa bilingüe. 
Constelación Magazine will be published quarterly, and all its stories will be in English and Spanish. Authors will be able to submit their stories in either language.
We will pay authors $0.08 per word (SFWA rates) and open up for submissions several times a year.
We will pay translators $0.04 per word, and raise the pay to $0.06 if we reach one of our stretch goals.
We will pay our cover artists $1000 for the cover art.
Constelación Magazine será cuatrimestral y todos los cuentos estarán en inglés y español. Los autores podrán enviar sus cuentos en cualquiera de los dos idiomas. 
Pagaremos $0,08 por palabra (estándar de SFWA) a los autores y abriremos las convocatorias varias veces al año. 
Pagaremos $0,04 por palabra a los traductores, y subiremos el pago a $0,06 si llegamos a una de nuestras metas más altas. 
Pagaremos $1.000 a los artistas por el arte de nuestras portadas. 
#1: The Bonds That Unite Us / Los lazos que nos unen. 
#2. Myths And Monsters / Mitos y monstruos. 
#3: Beyond The Stars / Más allá de las estrellas.
#4: Love Needs No Translation / El amor no necesita traducción.
